articles.name: articles
articles.tableDefinition: CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS _content_articles (id TEXT PRIMARY KEY, "title" VARCHAR, "author" VARCHAR, "author_avatar" VARCHAR, "author_description" VARCHAR, "body" TEXT, "date" DATE, "description" VARCHAR, "extension" VARCHAR, "meta" TEXT, "navigation" TEXT DEFAULT true, "path" VARCHAR, "rawbody" VARCHAR, "seo" TEXT DEFAULT '{}', "sitemap" TEXT NULL, "stem" VARCHAR, "tags" TEXT NULL, "thumbnail" VARCHAR, "__hash__" TEXT UNIQUE);

info.name: info
info.tableDefinition: CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS _content_info (id TEXT PRIMARY KEY, "ready" BOOLEAN, "structureVersion" VARCHAR, "version" VARCHAR, "__hash__" TEXT UNIQUE);

attrs.title: Default Attributes
attrs.description:
Attributes applied to every icon component.

@default { "aria-hidden": true }

mode.title: Default Rendering Mode
mode.description: Set the default rendering mode for the icon component

aliases.title: Icon aliases
aliases.description: Define Icon aliases to update them easily without code changes.

cssSelectorPrefix.title: CSS Selector Prefix
cssSelectorPrefix.description: Set the default CSS selector prefix.

cssWherePseudo.title: Use CSS `:where()` Pseudo Selector
cssWherePseudo.description: Use CSS `:where()` pseudo selector to reduce specificity.

collections.title: Icon Collections
collections.description:
List of known icon collections name. Used to resolve collection name ambiguity.
e.g. `simple-icons-github` -> `simple-icons:github` instead of `simple:icons-github`

When not provided, will use the full Iconify collection list.

provider.title: Icon Provider
provider.description:
Provider to use for fetching icons

- `server` - Fetch icons with a server handler
- `iconify` - Fetch icons with Iconify API, purely client-side
- `none` - Do not fetch icons (use client bundle only)

`server` by default; `iconify` when `ssr: false`

iconifyApiEndpoint.title: Iconify API Endpoint URL
iconifyApiEndpoint.description: Define a custom Iconify API endpoint URL. Useful if you want to use a self-hosted Iconify API. Learn more: https://iconify.design/docs/api.

fallbackToApi.title: Fallback to Iconify API
fallbackToApi.description: Fallback to Iconify API if server provider fails to found the collection.

localApiEndpoint.title: Local API Endpoint Path
localApiEndpoint.description: Define a custom path for the local API endpoint.

fetchTimeout.title: Fetch Timeout
fetchTimeout.description: Set the timeout for fetching icons.

customize.title: Customize callback
customize.description: Customize icon content (replace stroke-width, colors, etc...).

props.description: The orientation between the content and the actions.

props.name: actions
props.description:
Display a list of actions:
- under the title and description when orientation is `vertical`
- next to the close button when orientation is `horizontal`
`{ size: 'xs' }`{lang="ts-type"}

to.name: to
to.description: Route Location the link should navigate to when clicked on.

path.name: path
path.description: A relative path to the current location. This property should be removed

replace.name: replace
replace.description: Replace the entry in the history instead of pushing a new entry

force.name: force
force.description:
Triggers the navigation even if the location is the same as the current one.
Note this will also add a new entry to the history unless `replace: true`
is passed.

state.name: state
state.description:
State to save using the History API. This cannot contain any reactive
values and some primitives like Symbols are forbidden. More info at
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/History/state

activeClass.name: activeClass
activeClass.description: Class to apply when the link is active

exactActiveClass.name: exactActiveClass
exactActiveClass.description: Class to apply when the link is exact active

ariaCurrentValue.name: ariaCurrentValue
ariaCurrentValue.description: Value passed to the attribute `aria-current` when the link is exact active.

viewTransition.name: viewTransition
viewTransition.description: Pass the returned promise of `router.push()` to `document.startViewTransition()` if supported.

active.name: active
active.description: Force the link to be active independent of the current route.

exact.name: exact
exact.description: Will only be active if the current route is an exact match.

exactQuery.name: exactQuery
exactQuery.description: Allows controlling how the current route query sets the link as active.

exactHash.name: exactHash
exactHash.description: Will only be active if the current route hash is an exact match.

inactiveClass.name: inactiveClass
inactiveClass.description: The class to apply when the link is inactive.

href.name: href
href.description: An alias for `to`. If used with `to`, `href` will be ignored

external.name: external
external.description: Forces the link to be considered as external (true) or internal (false). This is helpful to handle edge-cases

target.name: target
target.description: Where to display the linked URL, as the name for a browsing context.

rel.name: rel
rel.description: A rel attribute value to apply on the link. Defaults to "noopener noreferrer" for external links.

noRel.name: noRel
noRel.description: If set to true, no rel attribute will be added to the link

prefetchedClass.name: prefetchedClass
prefetchedClass.description: A class to apply to links that have been prefetched.

prefetch.name: prefetch
prefetch.description: When enabled will prefetch middleware, layouts and payloads of links in the viewport.

prefetchOn.name: prefetchOn
prefetchOn.description: Allows controlling when to prefetch links. By default, prefetch is triggered only on visibility.
prefetchOn.type: "visibility" | "interaction" | Partial<{ visibility: boolean; interaction: boolean; }> | undefined

schema.type: "visibility" | "interaction" | Partial<{ visibility: boolean; interaction: boolean; }> | undefined

props.name: close
props.description:
Display a close button to dismiss the alert.
`{ size: 'md', color: 'neutral', variant: 'link' }`{lang="ts-type"}

props.name: closeIcon
props.description: The icon displayed in the close button.

props.name: as
props.description: The element or component this component should render as.

enablePinning.name: enablePinning
enablePinning.description: Enables/disables column pinning for this column. Defaults to `true`.

enableColumnFilter.name: enableColumnFilter
enableColumnFilter.description: Enables/disables the **column** filter for this column.

filterFn.name: filterFn
filterFn.description: The filter function to use with this column. Can be the name of a built-in filter function or a custom filter function.

11.type: (row: Row<unknown>, columnId: string, filterValue: any, addMeta: (meta: FilterMeta) => void): boolean

enableGlobalFilter.name: enableGlobalFilter
enableGlobalFilter.description: Enables/disables the **global** filter for this column.

invertSorting.name: invertSorting
invertSorting.description: Inverts the order of the sorting for this column. This is useful for values that have an inverted best/worst scale where lower numbers are better, eg. a ranking (1st, 2nd, 3rd) or golf-like scoring

sortDescFirst.name: sortDescFirst
sortDescFirst.description: Set to `true` for sorting toggles on this column to start in the descending direction.

sortingFn.name: sortingFn
sortingFn.description:
The sorting function to use with this column.
- A `string` referencing a built-in sorting function
- A custom sorting function

8.type: (rowA: Row<unknown>, rowB: Row<unknown>, columnId: string): number

sortUndefined.name: sortUndefined
sortUndefined.description:
The priority of undefined values when sorting this column.
- `false`
  - Undefined values will be considered tied and need to be sorted by the next column filter or original index (whichever applies)
- `-1`
  - Undefined values will be sorted with higher priority (ascending) (if ascending, undefined will appear on the beginning of the list)
- `1`
  - Undefined values will be sorted with lower priority (descending) (if ascending, undefined will appear on the end of the list)

aggregatedCell.name: aggregatedCell
aggregatedCell.description: The cell to display each row for the column if the cell is an aggregate. If a function is passed, it will be passed a props object with the context of the cell and should return the property type for your adapter (the exact type depends on the adapter being used).

aggregationFn.name: aggregationFn
aggregationFn.description: The resolved aggregation function for the column.

11.type: (columnId: string, leafRows: Row<unknown>[], childRows: Row<unknown>[]): any

getGroupingValue.name: getGroupingValue
getGroupingValue.description: Specify a value to be used for grouping rows on this column. If this option is not specified, the value derived from `accessorKey` / `accessorFn` will be used instead.

enableResizing.name: enableResizing
enableResizing.description: Enables or disables column resizing for the column.

maxSize.name: maxSize
maxSize.description: The maximum allowed size for the column

minSize.name: minSize
minSize.description: The minimum allowed size for the column

size.name: size
size.description: The desired size for the column

maxSize.name: maxSize
maxSize.description: The maximum allowed size for the column

minSize.name: minSize
minSize.description: The minimum allowed size for the column

size.name: size
size.description: The desired size for the column

enablePinning.name: enablePinning
enablePinning.description: Enables/disables column pinning for this column. Defaults to `true`.

enableColumnFilter.name: enableColumnFilter
enableColumnFilter.description: Enables/disables the **column** filter for this column.

filterFn.name: filterFn
filterFn.description: The filter function to use with this column. Can be the name of a built-in filter function or a custom filter function.

enableGlobalFilter.name: enableGlobalFilter
enableGlobalFilter.description: Enables/disables the **global** filter for this column.

invertSorting.name: invertSorting
invertSorting.description: Inverts the order of the sorting for this column. This is useful for values that have an inverted best/worst scale where lower numbers are better, eg. a ranking (1st, 2nd, 3rd) or golf-like scoring

sortDescFirst.name: sortDescFirst
sortDescFirst.description: Set to `true` for sorting toggles on this column to start in the descending direction.

sortingFn.name: sortingFn
sortingFn.description:
The sorting function to use with this column.
- A `string` referencing a built-in sorting function
- A custom sorting function

sortUndefined.name: sortUndefined
sortUndefined.description:
The priority of undefined values when sorting this column.
- `false`
  - Undefined values will be considered tied and need to be sorted by the next column filter or original index (whichever applies)
- `-1`
  - Undefined values will be sorted with higher priority (ascending) (if ascending, undefined will appear on the beginning of the list)
- `1`
  - Undefined values will be sorted with lower priority (descending) (if ascending, undefined will appear on the end of the list)

aggregatedCell.name: aggregatedCell
aggregatedCell.description: The cell to display each row for the column if the cell is an aggregate. If a function is passed, it will be passed a props object with the context of the cell and should return the property type for your adapter (the exact type depends on the adapter being used).

aggregationFn.name: aggregationFn
aggregationFn.description: The resolved aggregation function for the column.

getGroupingValue.name: getGroupingValue
getGroupingValue.description: Specify a value to be used for grouping rows on this column. If this option is not specified, the value derived from `accessorKey` / `accessorFn` will be used instead.

  - Undefined values will be considered tied and need to be sorted by the next column filter or original index (whichever applies)
- `-1`
  - Undefined values will be sorted with higher priority (ascending) (if ascending, undefined will appear on the beginning of the list)
- `1`
  - Undefined values will be sorted with lower priority (descending) (if ascending, undefined will appear on the end of the list)

aggregatedCell.name: aggregatedCell
aggregatedCell.description: The cell to display each row for the column if the cell is an aggregate. If a function is passed, it will be passed a props object with the context of the cell and should return the property type for your adapter (the exact type depends on the adapter being used).

aggregationFn.description: The resolved aggregation function for the column.

getGroupingValue.name: getGroupingValue
getGroupingValue.description: Specify a value to be used for grouping rows on this column. If this option is not specified, the value derived from `accessorKey` / `accessorFn` will be used instead.

enableResizing.name: enableResizing
enableResizing.description: Enables or disables column resizing for the column.

maxSize.name: maxSize
maxSize.description: The maximum allowed size for the column

minSize.description: The minimum allowed size for the column

size.name: size

enablePinning.name: enablePinning
enablePinning.description: Enables/disables column pinning for this column. Defaults to `true`.

enableColumnFilter.name: enableColumnFilter
enableColumnFilter.description: Enables/disables the **column** filter for this column.

filterFn.name: filterFn
filterFn.description: The filter function to use with this column. Can be the name of a built-in filter function or a custom filter function.

enableGlobalFilter.name: enableGlobalFilter
enableGlobalFilter.description: Enables/disables the **global** filter for this column.

invertSorting.name: invertSorting
invertSorting.description: Inverts the order of the sorting for this column. This is useful for values that have an inverted best/worst scale where lower numbers are better, eg. a ranking (1st, 2nd, 3rd) or golf-like scoring

sortDescFirst.name: sortDescFirst
sortDescFirst.description: Set to `true` for sorting toggles on this column to start in the descending direction.

sortingFn.name: sortingFn
sortingFn.description:
The sorting function to use with this column.
- A `string` referencing a built-in sorting function
- A custom sorting function

sortUndefined.name: sortUndefined

The priority of undefined values when sorting this column.
- `false`
  - Undefined values will be considered tied and need to be sorted by the next column filter or original index (whichever applies)
- `-1`
  - Undefined values will be sorted with higher priority (ascending) (if ascending, undefined will appear on the beginning of the list)
- `1`
  - Undefined values will be sorted with lower priority (descending) (if ascending, undefined will appear on the end of the list)

props.name: meta

props.name: sticky
props.description: Whether the table should have a sticky header or footer. True for both, 'header' for header only, 'footer' for footer only.

props.name: loading

props.name: watchOptions
props.description: Use the `watchOptions` prop to customize reactivity (for ex: disable deep watching for changes in your data or limiting the max traversal depth). This can improve performance by reducing unnecessary re-renders, but it should be used with caution as it may lead to unexpected behavior if not managed properly.

props.name: _features
props.description: An array of extra features that you can add to the table instance.

props.name: autoResetAll
props.description: Set this option to override any of the `autoReset...` feature options.

props.name: debugAll
props.description: Set this option to `true` to output all debugging information to the console.

props.name: debugCells
props.description: Set this option to `true` to output cell debugging information to the console.

props.name: debugColumns
props.description: Set this option to `true` to output column debugging information to the console.

props.name: debugHeaders
props.description: Set this option to `true` to output header debugging information to the console.

props.name: debugRows
props.description: Set this option to `true` to output row debugging information to the console.

props.name: debugTable
props.description: Set this option to `true` to output table debugging information to the console.

props.name: defaultColumn
props.description: Default column options to use for all column defs supplied to the table.

props.name: getRowId
props.description: This optional function is used to derive a unique ID for any given row. If not provided the rows index is used (nested rows join together with `.` using their grandparents' index eg. `index.index.index`). If you need to identify individual rows that are originating from any server-side operations, it's suggested you use this function to return an ID that makes sense regardless of network IO/ambiguity eg. a userId, taskId, database ID field, etc.
props.type: ((originalRow: unknown, index: number, parent?: Row<unknown> | undefined) => string) | undefined

schema.type: ((originalRow: unknown, index: number, parent?: Row<unknown> | undefined) => string) | undefined

1.type: (originalRow: unknown, index: number, parent?: Row<unknown> | undefined): string

props.name: getSubRows
props.description: This optional function is used to access the sub rows for any given row. If you are using nested rows, you will need to use this function to return the sub rows object (or undefined) from the row.
props.type: ((originalRow: unknown, index: number) => unknown[] | undefined) | undefined

schema.type: ((originalRow: unknown, index: number) => unknown[] | undefined) | undefined

props.name: initialState
props.description:
Use this option to optionally pass initial state to the table. This state will be used when resetting various table states either automatically by the table (eg. `options.autoResetPageIndex`) or via functions like `table.resetRowSelection()`. Most reset function allow you optionally pass a flag to reset to a blank/default state instead of the initial state.

Table state will not be reset when this object changes, which also means that the initial state object does not need to be stable.

props.name: mergeOptions
props.description: This option is used to optionally implement the merging of table options.

4.type: (content: string, name?: string | undefined, prefix?: string | undefined, provider?: string | undefined): string
